posts.cooked:
I’m running two clusters and one of those clusters runs a set of dr_agent processes.
I can’t seem to make the switchover work.

Seems I encounter DBA_SwitchOverPossibleDRAgentsIncorrectSetup.

This is the event trace from the fdbdr switch command:

bash-5.1$ fdbdr switch -s /etc/foundationdb/primary_fdb.cluster -d /etc/foundationdb/fdb.cluster --log
ERROR: An error was encountered during submission
Fatal Error: Backup error
bash-5.1$ cat trace.172.26.8.190.325.1750417328.sFK5VL.0.1.xml

I start my dr_agents in the foundationdb.conf file like this:

...
[dr_agent]
command = /usr/bin/dr_agent
logdir = /var/log/foundationdb/dr_agent
trace_format = json
source = /etc/foundationdb/primary_fdb.cluster

[fdbserver.4600]
[fdbserver.4601]
[fdbserver.4602]

[dr_agent.0]
[dr_agent.1]
[dr_agent.2]

The secondary cluster gets up to speed when I start the DR with fdbdr, so the dr_agents are working fine. Only the switch operation seems to error out.
whats “incorrect setup” about them?

Seems that this error is related to

github.com/apple/foundationdb

fdbclient/DatabaseBackupAgent.actor.cpp

2b9b0f778 

      
    
          
  1. 		// Check if there are agents set up with src as its destination cluster and dest as its source cluster
    2. 
          
  2. 		auto srcDRAgents = getDRAgentsIds(srcStatus, "dr_backup_dest");
    3. 
          
  3. 		auto destDRAgents = getDRAgentsIds(destStatus, "dr_backup");
    4. 
          
  4. 		std::set<std::string> intersectingAgents;
    5. 
          
  5. 		std::set_intersection(srcDRAgents.begin(),
    6. 
          
  6. 		                      srcDRAgents.end(),
    7. 
          
  7. 		                      destDRAgents.begin(),
    8. 
          
  8. 		                      destDRAgents.end(),
    9. 
          
  9. 		                      std::inserter(intersectingAgents, intersectingAgents.begin()));
    10. 
          
  10. 		if (intersectingAgents.empty()) {
    11. 
          
  11. 			TraceEvent(SevWarn, "DBA_SwitchOverPossibleDRAgentsIncorrectSetup").log();
    12. 
          
  12. 			throw backup_error();
    13. 
          
  13. 		}
    14. 
          
  14. 	} catch (std::runtime_error& e) {
    15. 
          
  15. 		TraceEvent(SevWarn, "DBA_UnableToCheckAtomicSwitchOverConfig").detail("RunTimeError", e.what());
    16. 
          
  16. 		throw backup_error();
    17. 
          
  17. 	}
    18. 
          
  18. 	return;
    19. 
          
  19. }
    20. 
          
  20. 
          
  21. class DatabaseBackupAgentImpl {
    22.

Seems that I have to setup some dr_agent processes on my primary DB too.

To further update on my progress, one of the issues my DR setup had was that I was using differently named clusterfiles on the two clusters (the clusterfile pointing to the primary cluster was named with different names on the primary cluster nodes compared to how it was named on the secondary cluster nodes).

If you want to run a fdbdr switch you HAVE to have some dr_agent processes configured with source pointing to the primary clusterfile and some dr_agent configured with source on the secondary clusterfile. And those clusterfiles have to have the same name.

Also when calling the fdbdr switch the -s and -d files have to be set in the direction of the current replication (not the direction you expect to switch to).

fancy_title: DBA SwitchOverPossibleDR AgentsIncorrectSetup during fdbdr switch
